PAL.NAME: Microsoft Exchange 2007
PAL.DESCRIPTION: Use this for general analysis of all Exchange 2007 Roles.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LogicalDisk Read Latency Analysis

THRESHOLD.NAME: Greater than 10ms logical disk READ response times
Greater than 20ms logical disk READ response times

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Avg. Disk sec/Read is the average time, in seconds, of a read of data to the disk. This analysis determines if any of the physical disks are responding slowly.

If the response times are greater than .010 (10 milliseconds), then the disk subsystem is keeping up with demand, but does not have much overhead left.

If the response times are greater than .020 (20 milliseconds), then noticeable slow downs and performance issues affecting users may be occurring.

Reference:
Ruling Out Disk-Bound Problems
http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/5bcdd349-dcc6-43eb-9dc3-54175f7061ad.aspx

ANALYSIS.NAME: LogicalDisk Write Latency Analysis

THRESHOLD.NAME: Greater than 10ms logical disk WRITE response times
Greater than 20ms logical disk WRITE response times
Greater than 900ms - Slower than a 3.5 inch floppy drive
THRESHOLD.CODE:
#// Use PowerShell code to create alerts when the conditions for this threshold are met. #// Optionally use the variables listed above in the Variables list box. #// If the condition for this threshold is a static value, then use the StaticThreshold() function. #// Otherwise, you will need to manually loop through the counter instance collection object. #// The counter instance collection object has a unique name for each counter data source in this analysis. #// See the variables in the Variables list box above for more information on the counter instance collection object.
#// Here is a ready to use example on how to use the StaticThreshold() function to define a threshold: StaticThreshold -CollectionOfCounterInstances $LogicalDiskAvgDisksecWriteALL -Operator 'gt' -Threshold 0.9 #// The -Operator parameter accepts gt for greater than, ge for greater than or equal to, lt for less than, #// and le for less than or equal to. -Threshold is the static value for the threshold.

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Avg. Disk sec/Write is the average time, in seconds, of a write of data to the disk. This analysis determines if any of the physical disks are responding slowly.

If the response times are greater than .010 (15 milliseconds), then the disk subsystem is keeping up with demand, but does not have much overhead left.

If the response times are greater than .020 (25 milliseconds), then noticeable slow downs and performance issues affecting users may be occurring.

Reference:
Ruling Out Disk-Bound Problems
http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/5bcdd349-dcc6-43eb-9dc3-54175f7061ad.aspx

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange ActiveSync Requests/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Requests/sec is the number of HTTP requests that are received from the client via ASP.NET per second.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Availability Service\Availability Requests (sec)
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Availability Requests per second is the number of requests serviced per second. The request can be only for free busy or include suggestions. One request may contain multiple mailboxes.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Availability Service Average Time to Process a Free Busy Request
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Free Busy Request
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Average Time to Process a Free Busy Request is the average time to process a free busy request in seconds. One request may contain multiple mailboxes. Free busy responses do not have meeting suggestions.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Free Busy Request
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Free Busy Request

THRESHOLD.NAME: Free busy requests taking longer than 5ms
Free busy requests taking longer than 25ms

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Free Busy Request
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Free Busy Request

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Availability Service Average Time to Process a Cross-Forest Free Busy Request
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Cross-Forest Free Busy Request
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Average Time to Process a Cross-Forest Free Busy Request is the average time to process a cross-forest free busy request in seconds. One request may contain multiple mailboxes. Free busy responses do not have meeting suggestions.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Cross-Forest Free Busy Request
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Cross-Forest Free Busy Request

THRESHOLD.NAME: Cross Forest Free busy requests taking longer than 5ms
Cross Forest Free busy requests taking longer than 25ms

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Cross-Forest Free Busy Request
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Cross-Forest Free Busy Request

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Availability Service Average Time to Process a Cross-Site Free Busy Request
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Cross-Site Free Busy Request
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Average Time to Process a Cross-Site Free Busy Request is the average time to process a cross-site free busy request in seconds. One request may contain multiple mailboxes. Free busy responses do not have meeting suggestions.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Cross-Site Free Busy Request
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Cross-Site Free Busy Request

THRESHOLD.NAME: Cross Site Free busy requests taking longer than 5ms
Cross Site Free busy requests taking longer than 25ms

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Cross-Site Free Busy Request
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Cross-Site Free Busy Request

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Availability Service Average Time to Process a Meeting Suggestions Request
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Meeting Suggestions Request
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Average Time to Process a Meeting Suggestions Request is the average time to process a meeting suggestions request in seconds. One request may contain multiple mailboxes. This time includes time for fetching free busy.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Meeting Suggestions Request
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Meeting Suggestions Request

THRESHOLD.NAME: Meeting suggestion requests taking longer than 5ms
Meeting suggestion requests taking longer than 25ms

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Meeting Suggestions Request
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Time to Process a Meeting Suggestions Request

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Availability Service Average Number of Mailboxes Processed per Request
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Number of Mailboxes Processed per Request
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Average Number of Mailboxes Processed per Request is the average number of mailboxes processed per request. Some of the mailboxes may have errors during processing.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Number of Mailboxes Processed per Request
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Number of Mailboxes Processed per Request

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Number of Mailboxes Processed per Request
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Availability Service\Average Number of Mailboxes Processed per Request

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange OWA Current Unique Users
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Current Unique Users is the number of unique users currently logged on to Outlook Web Access. This value monitors the number of unique active user sessions, so that users are only removed from this count after they log off or their session times out.

This is used for information purposes only.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeFDS:OAB Download Task Queued
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Download Task Queued is '1' if task is queued for execution, otherwise '0.'

This is used for information purposes only.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeFDS:UM Download Task Queued
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Download Task Queued is '1' if task is queued for execution, otherwise '0.'

This is used for information purposes only.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange OWA Average Search Time
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Average Search Time is the average time that elapsed while waiting for a search to complete.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange OWA Requests/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Requests/sec is the number of requests handled by Outlook Web Access per second.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeWS Requests/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Requests per second is the number of requests processed each second.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange OWA Average Response Time
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Average Response Time is the average time (in milliseconds) that elapsed between the beginning and end of an OEH or ASPX request.

THRESHOLD.NAME: OWA response times high - greater than 100ms
OWA response times very high - greater than 500ms
OWA response times critical - greater than 1000ms

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange OWA Queued Conversion Requests
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Queued Conversion Requests is the number of requests for conversion that are currently waiting to be processed.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange OWA Active Conversions
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Active Conversions is the number of conversions that are currently being processed by the WebReady Document Viewing service.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange OWA Average Conversion Time
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Average Conversion Time is the average length of time, in milliseconds, it has taken to convert a document since the process was restarted.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangePop3 Connections Current
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Current Connections is the number of connections that are currently open on the POP service.

This counter is used to report load on the server.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangePop3 Average Command Processing Time (milliseconds)
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Average Command Processing Time is the average processing time, in milliseconds, for the last 1024 commands received from clients.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeImap4 Average Command Processing Time (milliseconds)
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Average Command Processing Time is the average processing time, in milliseconds, for the last 1024 commands received from clients.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeImap4 Current Connections
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Current Connections is the number of connections that are currently open on the IMAP service.

This counter is used to report load on the server.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeAutodiscover Requests/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Requests per second is the number of Autodiscover requests processed each second.

This counter is used to report load on the server.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers LDAP Search Time
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: LDAP Search Time is the time (in ms) taken to send an LDAP search request and receive a response

THRESHOLD.NAME: Average LDAP search times - greater than 50ms
Average LDAP search times - greater than 100ms
Average LDAP search times - greater than 500ms

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange ADAccess Caches LDAP Searches/Sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: LDAP Searches/Sec is the number of LDAP search requests issued per second.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers LDAP Read Time
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: LDAP Read Time for a given DC is the time (in ms) taken to send an LDAP read request to the specified DC and receive a response

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange ADAccess Processes LDAP Read Time
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: LDAP Read Time is the time (in ms) taken to send an LDAP read request and receive a response

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange ADAccess Processes LDAP Search Time
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: LDAP Search Time is the time (in ms) taken to send an LDAP search request and receive a response

THRESHOLD.NAME: Average LDAP Search times - greater than 50ms
Average LDAP search times - greater than 100ms
Average LDAP search times - greater than 500ms

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers LDAP Searches timed out per minute
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers(*)\LDAP Searches timed out per minute
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
LDAP Searches timed out per minute is the number of LDAP searches returned LDAP_TIMEOUT during the last minute

This counter is indicitive of an overloaded domain controller or there are network connectivity problems to the DC.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers(*)\LDAP Searches timed out per minute
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers(*)\LDAP Searches timed out per minute

THRESHOLD.NAME: LDAP Searches timed out per minute - greater than 10
LDAP Searches timed out per minute - greater than 20

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers(*)\LDAP Searches timed out per minute
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers(*)\LDAP Searches timed out per minute

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers Long running LDAP operations/Min
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers(*)\Long running LDAP operations/Min
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Long running LDAP operations/Min is the number of LDAP operations on this DC that took longer than the specified threshold per minute (default threshold is 15 seconds)

This counter is useful for determining domain controller latencies that may affect overall Exchange performance.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers(*)\Long running LDAP operations/Min
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers(*)\Long running LDAP operations/Min

THRESHOLD.NAME: Long Running LDAP operations/min - greater than 50
Long Running LDAP operations/min - greater than 100

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers(*)\Long running LDAP operations/Min
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers(*)\Long running LDAP operations/Min

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange ADAccess Domain Controllers LDAP Search calls/Sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
LDAP Search calls/Sec is the number of Depth 1 or 2 LDAP Search calls made by this process per second

This counter is useful to determine if there is an increase in LDAP calls to the domain controllers possibly affecting overall latency on the server.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Database ==> Instances Log Generation Checkpoint Depth
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Log Generation Checkpoint Depth represents the amount of work, in count of log files, that will need to be redone or undone to the database file(s) if the process crashes.

The Log Generation Checkpoint Depth performance counter reports the number of transaction log files that have not yet been saved to the database. This number represents the number of transaction log files that must be replayed to the database if the Microsoft Exchange Information Store service process (Store.exe) stops and needs to be restarted. As the log file generation depth increases, the Exchange Information Store startup time increases. If the transaction log file depth of a storage group reaches 5,000, the Extensible Storage Engine (ESE) dismounts all the databases that are in the affected storage group.

This alert indicates that the checkpoint depth is greater than 2500. The transaction log file depth may grow during periods when the server is busy. However, large values typically occur when there is a failure or when a backup fails.

User Action:
To resolve this error, do one or more of the following:

  • Check if there is a failure, or if there is any application causing the Exchange Information Store to fail. Resolve the cause of the failure so that the checkpoint depth will start to decrease.
  • Check if there is a backup process that has failed.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Database Database Page Fault Stalls/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Database Page Fault Stalls/sec is the rate of page faults that cannot be serviced because there are no pages available for allocation from the database cache. If this counter is non-zero most of the time, the clean threshold may be too low.

THRESHOLD.NAME: Disk bottleneck detected

ANALYSIS.NAME: Database Log Record Stalls/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Log Record Stalls/sec is the number of log records that cannot be added to the log buffers per second because they are full. If this counter is non-zero most of the time, the log buffer size may be a bottleneck.

THRESHOLD.NAME: Log records not being processed in a timely fashion - greater than 10
High log record stalls due to server performance issues - greater than 100

ANALYSIS.NAME: Database Log Threads Waiting
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Log Threads Waiting is the number of threads waiting for their data to be written to the log in order to complete an update of the database. If this number is too high, the log may be a bottleneck.

THRESHOLD.NAME: Log threads not being processed in a timely manner - greater than 10
Log threads not being processed in a timely manner - greater than 100

ANALYSIS.NAME: Database Version buckets allocated
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Total number of version buckets allocated

THRESHOLD.NAME: High amount of queued transactions in Store - Performance may be affected

ANALYSIS.NAME: Database Database Cache Size
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Database Cache Size is the amount of system memory used by the database cache manager to hold commonly used information from the database file(s) to prevent file operations. If the database cache size seems to be too small for optimal performance and there is very little available memory on the system (see Memory/Available Bytes), adding more memory to the system may increase performance. If there is a lot of available memory on the system and the database cache size is not growing beyond a certain point, the database cache size may be capped at an artificially low limit. Increasing this limit may increase performance.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Client RPC Operations/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: RPC Operations/sec is the rate that RPC operations occur.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Mailbox Slow FindRow Rate
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Slow FindRow Rate is the rate at which the slower FindRow needs to be used in the mailbox store.

THRESHOLD.NAME: Moderate use of client applications crawling mailboxes
Heavy use of client applications crawling mailboxes

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Mailbox Messages Delivered/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Messages Delivered/sec is the rate that messages are delivered to all recipients.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Mailbox Messages Queued For Submission
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Messages Queued For Submission is the current number of submitted messages which are not yet processed by transport.

If there are messages queued for this counter, this this means that the HUB server(s) is not picking up mail in a timely fashion.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Mailbox Messages Sent/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Messages Sent/sec is the rate that messages are sent to the transport.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Mailbox Messages Submitted/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Messages Submitted/sec is the rate that messages are submitted by clients.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS RPC Averaged Latency
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: RPC latency in milliseconds averaged for the past 1024 packets.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS RPC Operations/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: RPC Operations/sec is the rate that RPC operations occur.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS RPC Requests
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: RPC Requests is the number of client requests that are currently being processed by the information store.

THRESHOLD.NAME: Queued RPC requests detected - greater than 70
High RPC requests detected - greater than 300

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS User Count
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: User Count is the number of users connected to the information store.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Virus Scan Queue Length
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Current number of outstanding requests that are queued for virus scanning.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Virus Scan Files Scanned/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The rate at which separate files are processed by virus scanner.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Virus Scan Messages Processed/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The rate at which top-level messages are processed by virus scanner.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS VM Largest Block Size
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Size of the largest free virtual memory block.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS VM Total 16MB Free Blocks
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Total number of free Virtual Memory blocks larger than or equal to 16MB.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS VM Total Free Blocks
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Total number of free Virtual Memory blocks.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS VM Total Large Free Block Bytes
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Total number of bytes in free Virtual Memory blocks larger than or equal to 16MB.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Mailbox Restricted View Cache Miss Rate
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Restricted View Cache Miss Rate is the rate at which restricted views are created in the mailbox store.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Memory Transition Faults/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Transition Faults/sec is the rate at which page faults are resolved by recovering pages that were being used by another process sharing the page, or were on the modified page list or the standby list, or were being written to disk at the time of the page fault. The pages were recovered without additional disk activity. Transition faults are counted in numbers of faults; because only one page is faulted in each operation, it is also equal to the number of pages faulted.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS RPC Num. of Slow Packets
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Number of RPC packets in the past 1024 that have latencies longer than 2 seconds.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS RPC Client Backoff/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: RPC Client Backoff/sec is the rate that server notifies a client to back off.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Client RPC Average Latency
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: RPC Average Latency is a server RPC latency in milliseconds averaged for the past 1024 packets.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Assistants Number of events processed per second.
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Assistants(*)\Number of events processed per second.
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of events processed per second.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Assistants(*)\Number of events processed per second.
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Assistants(*)\Number of events processed per second.

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Assistants(*)\Number of events processed per second.
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Assistants(*)\Number of events processed per second.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Store Interface RPC Latency average (msec)
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: RPC Latency average (msec) is the average latency in milliseconds of RPC requests. Average is calculated over all RPCs since exrpc32 was loaded.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Store Interface RPC Requests outstanding
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: RPC Requests outstanding is the current number of outstanding RPC requests.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeMailSubmission Hub Servers In Retry
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Hub Servers In Retry is the number of hub servers in retry.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Database Database Cache Size
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Database Cache Size is the amount of system memory used by the database cache manager to hold commonly used information from the database file(s) to prevent file operations. If the database cache size seems to be too small for optimal performance and there is very little available memory on the system (see Memory/Available Bytes), adding more memory to the system may increase performance. If there is a lot of available memory on the system and the database cache size is not growing beyond a certain point, the database cache size may be capped at an artificially low limit. Increasing this limit may increase performance.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Database Database Page Fault Stalls/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Database Page Fault Stalls/sec is the rate of page faults that cannot be serviced because there are no pages available for allocation from the database cache. If this counter is non-zero most of the time, the clean threshold may be too low.

THRESHOLD.NAME: Disk bottleneck detected

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Database Log Record Stalls/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Log Record Stalls/sec is the number of log records that cannot be added to the log buffers per second because they are full. If this counter is non-zero most of the time, the log buffer size may be a bottleneck.

THRESHOLD.NAME: Log records not being processed in a timely fashion - greater than 10
High log record stalls due to server performance issues - greater than 100

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Database Log Threads Waiting
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Log Threads Waiting is the number of threads waiting for their data to be written to the log in order to complete an update of the database. If this number is too high, the log may be a bottleneck.

THRESHOLD.NAME: Log threads not being processed in a timely manner - greater than 10
Log threads not being processed in a timely manner - greater than 100

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Database Version buckets allocated
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Total number of version buckets allocated

THRESHOLD.NAME: High amount of queued transactions in Store - Performance may be affected

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Database ==> Instances I/O Database Reads Average Latency
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(*)\I/O Database Reads Average Latency
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: I/O Database Reads Average Latency is the average length of time, in milliseconds, per database read operation.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(*)\I/O Database Reads Average Latency
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(*)\I/O Database Reads Average Latency

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(*)\I/O Database Reads Average Latency
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(*)\I/O Database Reads Average Latency

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Database ==> Instances I/O Database Writes Average Latency
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(*)\I/O Database Writes Average Latency
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: I/O Database Writes Average Latency is the average length of time, in milliseconds, per database write operation.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(*)\I/O Database Writes Average Latency
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(*)\I/O Database Writes Average Latency

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(*)\I/O Database Writes Average Latency
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(*)\I/O Database Writes Average Latency

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Database Database Cache % Hit
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Database Cache % Hit is the percentage of database file page requests that were fulfilled by the database cache without causing a file operation. If this percentage is too low, the database cache size may be too small.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Client JET Log Records/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: JET Log Records/sec is the rate that database log records are generated while processing requests for the client.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Client JET Pages Read/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: JET Pages Read/sec is the rate that database pages are read from disk while processing requests for the client.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Client Directory Access: LDAP Reads/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Directory Access: LDAP Reads/sec is the rate LDAP reads occur while processing requests for the client.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Client Directory Access: LDAP Searches/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Directory Access: LDAP Searches/sec is the rate LDAP searches occur while processing requests for the client.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Client: RPCs Failed: Server Too Busy / sec
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchangeIS\Client: RPCs Failed: Server Too Busy / sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The client-reported rate of failed RPCs (since the store was started) due to the Server Too Busy RPC error.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchangeIS\Client: RPCs Failed: Server Too Busy / sec
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchangeIS\Client: RPCs Failed: Server Too Busy / sec

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchangeIS\Client: RPCs Failed: Server Too Busy / sec
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchangeIS\Client: RPCs Failed: Server Too Busy / sec

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Client: RPCs Failed: Server Too Busy
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The client-reported number of failed RPCs (since the store was started) due to the Server Too Busy RPC error.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Database Log Bytes Write/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Log Bytes Write per second is the rate bytes are written to the log.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Public Receive Queue Size
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Receive Queue Size is the number of messages in the public store's receive queue.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Slow QP Threads
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Number of Query Processor threads currently running unoptimized queries.

This counter is essentially incremented when an un-optimized search for a string in the text context or subject occurred.

If this counter is sustained over 20, store version buckets is very high, and RPC requests flatlines at the same time, then 623 events might be occurring due to a queued transaction inside Store. See http://blogs.technet.com/mikelag/archive/2008/08/22/search-folder-performance-problem-detection.aspx for additional information

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Slow Search Threads
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Number of Search threads currently running unoptimized queries.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Mailbox Categorization Count
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Categorization Count is the number of categorizations that exist in the mailbox store. Categorizations are created when a user creates a filtered view or performs a search. When the information store must maintain an excessive number of categorizations, performance can be affected.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Search Indices Throttling Delay Value
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Throttling Delay Value is the total Total time (in milliseconds) a worker thread sleeps before it retrieves a document from the Exchange Information Store service. This is set by the throttling monitor thread.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Search Indices Average document indexing time
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Average Document Indexing Time is the average (in milliseconds) of how long it takes to index documents.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Search Indices Full Crawl Mode Status
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Full Crawl Mode Status indicates whether this MDB is going through a full crawl (value=1) or not (value=0).

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Assistants Mailboxes processed/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Mailboxes processed/sec is the rate of mailboxes processed by time-based assistants per second.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Assistants Events Polled/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of events polled per second.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Assistants Events in queue
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Events in queue is the current number of events in the in-memory queue waiting to be processed by the assistants.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Assistants Average Event Processing Time In seconds
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Assistants(*)\Average Event Processing Time In seconds
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Average processing time of the events chosen as interesting.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Assistants(*)\Average Event Processing Time In seconds
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Assistants(*)\Average Event Processing Time In seconds

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Assistants(*)\Average Event Processing Time In seconds
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Assistants(*)\Average Event Processing Time In seconds

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Resource Booking Average Resource Booking Processing Time
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Resource Booking\Average Resource Booking Processing Time
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Average Resource Booking Processing Time is the average time to process an event in the Resource Booking Attendant.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Resource Booking\Average Resource Booking Processing Time
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Resource Booking\Average Resource Booking Processing Time

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Resource Booking\Average Resource Booking Processing Time
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Resource Booking\Average Resource Booking Processing Time

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Resource Booking Requests Failed
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Requests Failed is the total number of failures that occurred while Resource Booking Attendant was processing events.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Calendar Attendant Average Calendar Attendant Processing Time
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Calendar Attendant\Average Calendar Attendant Processing Time
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Average Calendar Attendant Processing Time is the average time to process an event in the Calendar Attendant.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Calendar Attendant\Average Calendar Attendant Processing Time
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Calendar Attendant\Average Calendar Attendant Processing Time

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Calendar Attendant\Average Calendar Attendant Processing Time
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Calendar Attendant\Average Calendar Attendant Processing Time

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Calendar Attendant Requests Failed
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Requests Failed is the total number of failures that occurred while Calendar Attendant was processing events.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Store Interface RPC Requests failed (%)
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: RPC Requests failed (%) is the percent of failed requests in total number of RPC requests. Here, failed means the sum of failed with error code plus failed with exception.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Store Interface RPC Requests sent/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: RPC Requests sent/sec is the current rate of initiated RPC requests per second.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Store Interface RPC Slow requests (%)
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: RPC Slow requests (%) is the percent of slow RPC requests among all RPC requests.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeMailSubmission Successful Submissions Per Second
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Successful Submissions Per Second

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeMailSubmission Failed Submissions Per Second
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Failed Submissions Per Second

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeMailSubmission Temporary Submission Failures/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Temporary Submission Failures per second is the number of temporary submission failures per second.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Replication CopyQueueLength
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Copy Queue Length is the number of log generations waiting to be both copied and inspected successfully.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Replication ReplayQueueLength
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Replay Queue Length is the number of log generations waiting to be replayed.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Replica Seeder Seeding Finished %
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Seeding Finished % is the finished percentage of seeding. Its value is from 0 to 100 percent.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Process IO Write Bytes/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The rate at which the process is writing bytes to I/O operations. This counter counts all I/O activity generated by the process to include file, network and device I/Os.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Process IO Data Bytes/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The rate at which the process is reading and writing bytes in I/O operations. This counter counts all I/O activity generated by the process to include file, network and device I/Os.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Process IO Read Bytes/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The rate at which the process is reading bytes from I/O operations. This counter counts all I/O activity generated by the process to include file, network and device I/Os.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Messages Submitted Per Second
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Messages Submitted Per Second is the number of messages enqueued in the submission queue per second.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Messages Completed Delivery Per Second
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Messages Completed Delivery Per Second is the number of messages delivery per second.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Active Mailbox Delivery Queue Length
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Active Mailbox Delivery Queue Length is the number of items in the active mailbox queues.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Active Non-Smtp Delivery Queue Length
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Active Non-Smtp Delivery Queue Length is the number of items in the active Non-Smtp queues.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Active Remote Delivery Queue Length
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Active Remote Delivery Queue Length is the number of items in the active remote delivery queues.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Retry Mailbox Delivery Queue Length
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Retry Mailbox Delivery Queue Length is the number of items in retry in the retry mailbox queues.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Retry Non-Smtp Delivery Queue Length
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Retry Non-Smtp Delivery Queue Length is the number of items in rety in the Non-Smtp queues.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Retry Remote Delivery Queue Length
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Retry Remote Delivery Queue Length is the number of items in retry in the remote delivery queues.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Submission Queue Length
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Submission Queue Length is the number of items in the submission queue.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Unreachable Queue Length
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Unreachable Queue Length is the number of items in the unreachable queues.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Dumpster Dumpster Size
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Item Size is the total size (in bytes) of mail items that are currently in the Transport Dumpster on this server.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Dumpster Dumpster Inserts/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Insert Rate is the rate at which items are inserted into the Transport Dumpster on this server.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Dumpster Dumpster Item Count
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Item Count is the total number of mail items that are currently in the Transport Dumpster on this server.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Dumpster Dumpster Deletes/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Delete Rate is the rate at which items are deleted from the Transport Dumpster on this server.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Database Stream writes/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: This counter should only be used if Microsoft Product Support services advises that they need this information to troubleshoot a complex ESE-related performance issue.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Database Stream read/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: This counter should only be used if Microsoft Product Support services advises that they need this information to troubleshoot a complex ESE-related performance issue.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Database MailItem begin commit/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: This counter should only be used if Microsoft Product Support services advises that they need this information to troubleshoot a complex ESE-related performance issue.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Batch Point Transactions committed/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: This counter should only be used if Microsoft Product Support services advises that they need this information to troubleshoot a complex ESE-related performance issue.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Extensibility Agents Average Agent Processing Time (sec)
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Average agent processing time in seconds per event.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Extensibility Agents Total Agent Invocations
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Total number of agent invocations since the last restart.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Store Driver Inbound: MessageDeliveryAttempts
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Inbound: Message Delivery Attempts is the number of attempt for delivering transport mailitem.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Store Driver Inbound: MessageDeliveryAttemptsPerSecond
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Inbound: Message Delivery Attempts Per Second is the number of attempts for delivering transport mailitem per second.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Aggregate Delivery Queue Length (All Queues)
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Aggregate Delivery Queue Length (All Queues) is the number of items queued for delivery in all queues.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Largest Delivery Queue Length
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Largest Delivery Queue Length is the number of messages in the largest delivery queue.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Poison Queue Length
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Poison Message Queue Length is the number of messages in the poison message queue.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Store Driver Inbound: LocalDeliveryCallsPerSecond
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Inbound: Local Delivery Calls Per Second is the number of local delivery attempts per second.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Store Driver Outbound: Submitted Mail Items Per Second
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Outbound: Submitted Mail Items Per Second
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Outbound: Submitted Mail Items Per Second is the number of mail items per second being submitted.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Outbound: Submitted Mail Items Per Second
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Outbound: Submitted Mail Items Per Second

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Outbound: Submitted Mail Items Per Second
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Outbound: Submitted Mail Items Per Second

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport SmtpReceive Average bytes/message
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Average Bytes/Message is the average number of message bytes per inbound message received.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport SmtpReceive Messages Received/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Messages Received/sec is the number of messages received by the SMTP server each second.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport SmtpSend Messages Sent/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Messages Sent/sec is the number of messages sent by the SMTP Send connector each second.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Store Driver Inbound: Recipients Delivered Per Second
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Inbound: Recipients Delivered Per Second
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Recipients delivered per second

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Inbound: Recipients Delivered Per Second
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Inbound: Recipients Delivered Per Second

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Inbound: Recipients Delivered Per Second
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Inbound: Recipients Delivered Per Second

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Database ==> Instances I/O Log Writes/sec
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Writes/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: I/O Log Writes/sec is the rate of logfile write operations completed.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Writes/sec
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Writes/sec

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Writes/sec
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Writes/sec

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Database ==> Instances I/O Log Reads/sec
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Reads/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: I/O Log Reads/sec is the rate of logfile read operations completed.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Reads/sec
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Reads/sec

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Reads/sec
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Reads/sec

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Database ==> Instances Version buckets allocated
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Version buckets allocated
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Total number of version buckets allocated

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Version buckets allocated
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Version buckets allocated

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Version buckets allocated
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Version buckets allocated

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Database ==> Instances I/O Database Reads/sec
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Reads/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: I/O Database Reads/sec is the rate of database read operations completed.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Reads/sec
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Reads/sec

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Reads/sec
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Reads/sec

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Database ==> Instances I/O Database Writes/sec
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Writes/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: I/O Database Writes/sec is the rate of database write operations completed.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Writes/sec
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Writes/sec

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Writes/sec
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Writes/sec

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Database ==> Instances Log Record Stalls/sec
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Record Stalls/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Log Record Stalls/sec is the number of log records that cannot be added to the log buffers per second because they are full. If this counter is non-zero most of the time, the log buffer size may be a bottleneck.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Record Stalls/sec
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Record Stalls/sec

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Record Stalls/sec
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Record Stalls/sec

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Database ==> Instances Log Threads Waiting
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Threads Waiting
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Log Threads Waiting is the number of threads waiting for their data to be written to the log in order to complete an update of the database. If this number is too high, the log may be a bottleneck.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Threads Waiting
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Threads Waiting

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Threads Waiting
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Threads Waiting

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Database ==> Instances Log Generation Checkpoint Depth
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Generation Checkpoint Depth
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Log Generation Checkpoint Depth represents the amount of work, in count of log files, that will need to be redone or undone to the database file(s) if the process crashes.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Generation Checkpoint Depth
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Generation Checkpoint Depth

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Generation Checkpoint Depth
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Generation Checkpoint Depth

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Store Interface RPC Slow requests latency average (msec)
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Store Interface(*)\RPC Slow requests latency average (msec)
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: RPC Slow requests latency average (msec) is the average latency in milliseconds of slow RPC requests.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Store Interface(*)\RPC Slow requests latency average (msec)
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Store Interface(*)\RPC Slow requests latency average (msec)

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Store Interface(*)\RPC Slow requests latency average (msec)
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Store Interface(*)\RPC Slow requests latency average (msec)

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Store Interface ROP Requests outstanding
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: ROP Requests outstanding is the total number of outstanding ROP requests.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeIS Mailbox Search Task Rate
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Number of search tasks created per second.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Search Indices Recent Average Latency of RPCs Used to Obtain Content
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Search Indices(*)\Recent Average Latency of RPCs Used to Obtain Content
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Recent Average Latency of RPCs Used to Obtain Content is the average latency (in milliseconds) of the most recent RPCs to the Exchange Information Store service. These RPCs are used to get content for the filter daemon for the given database.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Search Indices(*)\Recent Average Latency of RPCs Used to Obtain Content
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Search Indices(*)\Recent Average Latency of RPCs Used to Obtain Content

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Search Indices(*)\Recent Average Latency of RPCs Used to Obtain Content
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Search Indices(*)\Recent Average Latency of RPCs Used to Obtain Content
